Stem: Smooth grey bark maturing to rough, corky and brownish-grey. Young stems are more green.
Leaves: 2-6 cm long in pairs each with 2-11 pairs of leaflets.
Flowers: Large clusters up to 6 cm long. Yellowish- green with pleasant fragrance. With fluffy appearance.
FruitSeeds: Large leathery to papery and straw to brown coloured pods, 12-35 cm long, without constrictions, and containing 3-12 brown flat seeds.
Habitat: Woodlands, riparian areas, hillsides. Likely native to some parts of northern Australia, but is naturalised beyond native range.
